title: Authors and Citation
text: Erjie Zhao. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhao E (2024). simpleEnrichr: simple Enrichment analysis wit R. R package version 0.1.0, https://moonerss.github.io/simpleEnrichr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {simpleEnrichr: simple Enrichment analysis wit R},   author = {Erjie Zhao},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://moonerss.github.io/simpleEnrichr/}, }

title: simple Enrichment analysis wit R
text: simpleEnrichr package run simple enrichment analysis

title: simple Enrichment analysis wit R
text: can install development version simpleEnrichr Github :
code: install.packages('remotes') remotes::install_github('Moonerss/simpleEnrichr')

title: simple Enrichment analysis wit R
text: run ORA enrichment analysis one time!!!
code: library(simpleEnrichr) #>  #>  #> ############################################################################## #> Pathview is an open source software package distributed under GNU General #> Public License version 3 (GPLv3). Details of GPLv3 is available at #> http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html. Particullary, users are required to #> formally cite the original Pathview paper (not just mention it) in publications #> or products. For details, do citation("pathview") within R. #>  #> The pathview downloads and uses KEGG data. Non-academic uses may require a KEGG #> license agreement (details at http://www.kegg.jp/kegg/legal.html). #> ############################################################################## genes <- c("CANX", "HSPA1B", "KLRC2", "PSMC6", "RFXAP", "TAP1") res <- simple_ORA(genes, enrich.type = "KEGG") #> ℹ Updating gene symbols... #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ℹ Transforming "SYMBOL" to ENTREZID... #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> ℹ Performing KEGG enrichment... #> ℹ 5 significant terms were detected... #> ✔ Done! res_all <- ORA_intergated(genes, enrich.type = c("KEGG", "MsigDB")) #> ℹ Updating gene symbols... #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ℹ Transforming "SYMBOL" to ENTREZID... #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> ℹ Performing KEGG enrichment... #> ℹ 5 significant terms were detected... #> ✔ Done! #> ℹ Updating gene symbols... #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ℹ Transforming "SYMBOL" to ENTREZID... #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> ℹ Performing MsigDB-"H" enrichment... #> ℹ 2 significant terms were detected... #> ✔ Done! #> ℹ Final statistics ... #> ℹ 7 significant terms were detected... #> ✔ Done! names(res_all) #> [1] "KEGG"   "MsigDB"

title: simple Enrichment analysis wit R
text: run GSEA enrichment analysis one time!!!
code: data(geneList, package="DOSE")  fit <- simple_GSEA(geneList, enrich.type = "KEGG", gene.type = "ENTREZID") #> ℹ Performing KEGG enrichment... #> ℹ 55 significant terms were detected.. #> ✔ Done! fit_all <- GSEA_intergated(geneList, gene.type = 'ENTREZID', enrich.type = c("MsigDB", "KEGG")) #> ℹ Performing MsigDB-"H" enrichment... #> ℹ 28 significant terms were detected.. #> ✔ Done! #> ℹ Performing KEGG enrichment... #> ℹ 55 significant terms were detected.. #> ✔ Done! #> ℹ Final statistics ... #> ℹ 83 significant terms were detected... #> ✔ Done! names(fit_all) #> [1] "MsigDB" "KEGG"

title: simple Enrichment analysis wit R
code: ORA_dotplot(res) GSEA_dotplot(fit) GSEA_rankplot(fit, Pathway.ID = 'hsa04110') ORA_two_barplot(res_all$KEGG, res_all$MsigDB, Selct.P = 'FDR', obj.types = c("KEGG", "MsigDB")) GSEA_two_barplot(fit, pos.top.pathway.num = 10, neg.top.pathway.num = 10)

title: A dataframe including drugs and their related genes — CMAPfromDSEATM

title: A dataframe including drugs and their related genes — CMAPfromDSEATM

what: Enrichment dotplot for positive or negative GSEA results — GSEA_dotplot
title: Enrichment dotplot for positive or negative GSEA results — GSEA_dotplot
text: Plot enrichment dotplot positive negative GSEA results.

title: Enrichment dotplot for positive or negative GSEA results — GSEA_dotplot
code: GSEA_dotplot(   enrich.obj,   type = c("pos", "neg"),   show.term.num = 15,   Selct.P = c("FDR", "P"),   cutoff.P = 0.05,   colors = c("blue", "white", "red"),   size.range = c(3, 8),   y.label.position = "right",   title = NULL,   legend.position = "right",   ggtheme = theme_bw(base_rect_size = 1),   ... )

title: Enrichment dotplot for positive or negative GSEA results — GSEA_dotplot
text: enrich.obj GSEA enrichment object clusterProfiler. type Specify whether want show positive negative results. show.term.num number list terms. number, first n terms displayed. list terms, selected terms displayed. Selct.P Selct.P P value (P) adjust P value (FDR) selected define significant terms. cutoff.P cutoff value Select.P. colors color vector dots. size.range Two numeric variables, first minimal value first maximal value. y.label.position Y label position. right left. title Title plot. legend.position Position legend. 'none', 'right', 'left' two numeric variables. ggtheme ggtheme plot. ... argument ggplot2::theme.

title: Enrichment dotplot for positive or negative GSEA results — GSEA_dotplot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(geneList, package="DOSE") GSEA_res <- simple_GSEA(geneList, gene.type = "ENTREZID", enrich.type = 'GO') GSEA_dotplot(res$simplyGO) } # }

what: Run GSEA analysis for all gene set — GSEA_intergated
title: Run GSEA analysis for all gene set — GSEA_intergated
text: Perform integrated gene set enrichment analysis included GO, KEGG, WikiPathways, Reactome, MsigDB, Disease Ontoloty, Cancer Gene Network, DisGeNET, CellMarker, CMAP.

title: Run GSEA analysis for all gene set — GSEA_intergated
code: GSEA_intergated(   genes,   gene.type = "SYMBOL",   organism = c("Human", "Mouse"),   enrich.type = c("GO", "KEGG", "MKEGG", "WikiPathways", "Reactome", "MsigDB", "DO",     "CGN", "DisGeNET", "CellMarker", "CMAP"),   GO.ont = "BP",   KEGG.use.internal.data = F,   MsigDB.category = "H",   pvalue.cutoff = 0.05,   padjust.method = "BH",   min.Geneset.Size = 10,   max.Geneset.Size = 1000,   CMAP.min.Geneset.Size = 3 )

title: Run GSEA analysis for all gene set — GSEA_intergated
text: genes simple_GSEA. gene.type simple_GSEA. organism simple_GSEA. enrich.type vector selected enrichment method. can set one GO, KEGG, MKEGG, WikiPathways, Reactome, MsigDB, , CGN, DisGeNET, CellMarker, CMAP. GO.ont simple_GSEA. KEGG.use.internal.data simple_GSEA. MsigDB.category simple_GSEA. pvalue.cutoff simple_GSEA. padjust.method simple_GSEA. min.Geneset.Size simple_GSEA. max.Geneset.Size simple_GSEA. CMAP.min.Geneset.Size simple_GSEA.

title: Run GSEA analysis for all gene set — GSEA_intergated
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   data(geneList, package="DOSE")    # Set enrich.type using an enrichment analysis method mentioned above.   fit <- GSEA_intergated(geneList, gene.type = 'ENTREZID', enrich.type = c("GO", "KEGG")) } # }

what: Visualize analyzing result of GSEA — GSEA_rankplot
title: Visualize analyzing result of GSEA — GSEA_rankplot
text: Visualize analyzing result GSEA.

title: Visualize analyzing result of GSEA — GSEA_rankplot
code: GSEA_rankplot(   GSEA.result,   Pathway.ID,   show.heatbar = T,   show.rank = T,   line.color = "#41A98E",   rank.colors = c("#440154FF", "#482878FF", "#3E4A89FF", "#31688EFF", "#26828EFF",     "#1F9E89FF", "#35B779FF", "#6DCD59FF", "#B4DE2CFF", "#FDE725FF"),   heatbar.colors = c("#08519C", "#3182BD", "#6BAED6", "#BDD7E7", "#EFF3FF", "#FEE5D9",     "#FCAE91", "#FB6A4A", "#DE2D26", "#A50F15"),   add.x.ann = T,   x.lab = "Gene ranks",   line.y.lab = "Enrichment score",   rank.y.lab = "logFC",   statistic.position = c(0.5, 0.2),   statistic.face = "italic",   statistic.size = 3.5,   ggtheme = theme_bw(base_rect_size = 1.5) )

title: Visualize analyzing result of GSEA — GSEA_rankplot
text: GSEA.result GSEA results clusterProfiler::GSEA() function. Pathway.ID Pathway ID ID column GSEA.result . show.heatbar Whether show heat bar. Default TRUE. show.rank Whether show Rank map. Default TRUE. line.color Line color running score. rank.colors Color scheme rank lines. vector. heatbar.colors Color scheme heatbar. vector. add.x.ann Whether add title, text, ticks X axis. x.lab x axis title. line.y.lab Y label running score plot. rank.y.lab Y label rank plot. statistic.position Position statistics running score plot. statistic.face Font face statistics. statistic.size Font size statistics. ggtheme theme object ggplot2.

title: Visualize analyzing result of GSEA — GSEA_rankplot
code: data(geneList, package="DOSE") GSEA_res <- simple_GSEA(geneList, gene.type = "ENTREZID", enrich.type = 'KEGG') #> ℹ Performing KEGG enrichment... #> ℹ 55 significant terms were detected.. #> ✔ Done! GSEA_rankplot(GSEA_res, Pathway.ID = 'hsa04110')

what: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — GSEA_two_barplot
title: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — GSEA_two_barplot
text: Plot enrichment barplot two ORA enrichment objects.

title: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — GSEA_two_barplot
code: GSEA_two_barplot(   enrich.obj,   Selct.P = c("FDR", "P"),   cutoff.P = 0.05,   type.colors = c("#ED6355", "#3E94B5"),   pos.top.pathway.num = 10,   neg.top.pathway.num = 10,   bar.width = 0.6,   add.bar.border = T,   x.limit.fold = 1.05,   label.size = 3.5,   legend.position = "bottom" )

title: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — GSEA_two_barplot
text: enrich.obj gseaResult object clusterProfiler. Selct.P P value (P) adjust P value (FDR) selected define significant terms. cutoff.P cutoff value Select.P. type.colors Two colors positive negative enrichment. pos.top.pathway.num number top pathways positive terms. Based significant test. neg.top.pathway.num number top pathways negative terms. Based significant test. bar.width Width bar plot. add.bar.border Logical. Whether add black border bars. x.limit.fold Specify fold x limitation. label.size Fontsize label. legend.position none, left, right, top, bottom; Two numeric variables indicated x y positions, respectively.

title: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — GSEA_two_barplot
code: data(geneList, package="DOSE")  # Set enrich.type using an enrichment analysis method mentioned above. fit <- simple_GSEA(geneList, enrich.type = "KEGG", gene.type = "ENTREZID") #> ℹ Performing KEGG enrichment... #> ℹ 55 significant terms were detected.. #> ✔ Done! GSEA_two_barplot(fit)

what: Plot barplot for enrihment result — ORA_barplot
title: Plot barplot for enrihment result — ORA_barplot
text: Plot barplot enrihment result

title: Plot barplot for enrihment result — ORA_barplot
code: ORA_barplot(   enrich.obj,   x = "RichFactor",   color.by = "p.adjust",   show.term.num = 15,   label_format = 30,   colors = c("white", "#126536"),   color.title = color.by,   bar.width = 0.6,   add.bar.border = FALSE,   y.label.position = "right",   title = NULL,   legend.position = "right",   ggtheme = theme_classic(),   ... )

title: Plot barplot for enrihment result — ORA_barplot
text: enrich.obj object clusterProfiler. x variable x-axis, one 'EnrichFactor', 'GeneRatio', 'pvalue', 'p.adjust', 'Count'. color.Variable used color enriched terms, one 'GeneRatio', 'pvalue', 'p.adjust', 'Count'. show.term.num number list terms. number, first n terms displayed. list terms, selected terms displayed. label_format numeric value sets wrap length, alternatively custom function format axis labels. default wraps names longer 30 characters. colors color vector bars. color.title Title color annotation legend. bar.width Width bars. add.bar.border Logical. Whether add black border bars. y.label.position Y label position. right, left. title Title plot. legend.position option legend. 'none', 'right', 'left' two numeric variables. ggtheme ggtheme plot. ... argument ggplot2::theme.

title: Plot barplot for enrihment result — ORA_barplot
code: genes <- c("CANX", "HSPA1B", "KLRC2", "PSMC6", "RFXAP", "TAP1") res <- simple_ORA(genes, enrich.type = "GO") #> ℹ Updating gene symbols... #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ℹ Transforming "SYMBOL" to ENTREZID... #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> ℹ Performing GO-"BP" enrichment... #> ℹ 6 significant terms were detected... #> ℹ Symplifying GO results... #> ℹ Return a list with raw enrich result and symplify result ... #> ✔ Done! ORA_barplot(res$GO, y.label.position = 'on', x = 'RichFactor')

'none', 'right', 'left' two numeric variables. ggtheme ggtheme plot. ... argument ggplot2::theme.

title: Plot Dotplot for enrihment result — ORA_dotplot
code: genes <- c("CANX", "HSPA1B", "KLRC2", "PSMC6", "RFXAP", "TAP1") res <- simple_ORA(genes, enrich.type = "GO") #> ℹ Updating gene symbols... #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ℹ Transforming "SYMBOL" to ENTREZID... #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> ℹ Performing GO-"BP" enrichment... #> ℹ 6 significant terms were detected... #> ℹ Symplifying GO results... #> ℹ Return a list with raw enrich result and symplify result ... #> ✔ Done! what: Run over-representative analysis for all gene set — ORA_intergated
title: Run over-representative analysis for all gene set — ORA_intergated
text: Perform integrated -representative enrichment analysis included GO, KEGG, WikiPathways, Reactome, MsigDB, Disease Ontoloty, Cancer Gene Network, DisGeNET, CellMarker, CMAP.

title: Run over-representative analysis for all gene set — ORA_intergated
code: ORA_intergated(   genes,   background.genes = NULL,   gene.type = "SYMBOL",   organism = c("Human", "Mouse"),   enrich.type = c("GO", "KEGG", "MKEGG", "WikiPathways", "Reactome", "MsigDB", "DO",     "CGN", "DisGeNET", "CellMarker", "CMAP"),   GO.ont = "BP",   KEGG.use.internal.data = F,   MsigDB.category = "H",   pvalue.cutoff = 0.05,   qvalue.cutoff = 0.05,   padjust.method = "BH",   min.Geneset.Size = 10,   max.Geneset.Size = 1000,   CMAP.min.Geneset.Size = 3 )

title: Run over-representative analysis for all gene set — ORA_intergated
text: genes simple_ORA. background.genes simple_ORA. gene.type simple_ORA. organism simple_ORA. enrich.type vector selected enrichment method. can set one GO, KEGG, MKEGG, WikiPathways, Reactome, MsigDB, , CGN, DisGeNET, CellMarker, CMAP. GO.ont simple_ORA. KEGG.use.internal.data simple_ORA. MsigDB.category simple_ORA. pvalue.cutoff simple_ORA. qvalue.cutoff simple_ORA. padjust.method simple_ORA. min.Geneset.Size simple_ORA. max.Geneset.Size simple_ORA. CMAP.min.Geneset.Size simple_ORA.

title: Run over-representative analysis for all gene set — ORA_intergated
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  genes <- c("CANX", "HSPA1B", "KLRC2", "PSMC6", "RFXAP", "TAP1")  res <- ORA_intergated(genes, enrich.type = c("GO", "KEGG")) } # }

what: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — ORA_two_barplot
title: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — ORA_two_barplot
text: Plot enrichment barplot two ORA enrichment objects.

title: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — ORA_two_barplot
code: ORA_two_barplot(   enrich.obj1,   enrich.obj2,   Selct.P = c("FDR", "P"),   cutoff.P = 0.05,   obj.types = c("Up", "Down"),   obj.type.colors = c("#ED6355", "#3E94B5"),   obj1.top.pathway.num = 10,   obj2.top.pathway.num = 10,   bar.width = 0.6,   add.bar.border = T,   x.limit.fold = 1.05,   label.size = 3.5,   legend.position = "bottom" )

title: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — ORA_two_barplot
text: enrich.obj1 enrichResult object clusterProfiler. enrich.obj2 enrichResult object clusterProfiler. Selct.P P value (P) adjust P value (FDR) selected define significant terms. cutoff.P cutoff value Select.P. obj.types Two characters defining types two objects. obj.type.colors Two colors types two objects. obj1.top.pathway.num number top pathways object 1. Based significant test. obj2.top.pathway.num number top pathways object 2. Based significant test. bar.width Width bar plot. add.bar.border Logical. Whether add black border bars. x.limit.fold Specify fold x limitation. label.size Fontsize label. legend.position none, left, right, top, bottom; Two numeric variables indicated x y positions, respectively.

title: Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects — ORA_two_barplot
code: genes <- c("CANX", "HSPA1B", "KLRC2", "PSMC6", "RFXAP", "TAP1") res1 <- simple_ORA(genes, enrich.type = "KEGG") #> ℹ Updating gene symbols... #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ℹ Transforming "SYMBOL" to ENTREZID... #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> ℹ Performing KEGG enrichment... #> ℹ 5 significant terms were detected... #> ✔ Done! res2 <- simple_ORA(genes, enrich.type = "MsigDB") #> ℹ Updating gene symbols... #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ℹ Transforming "SYMBOL" to ENTREZID... #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> ℹ Performing MsigDB-"H" enrichment... #> ℹ 2 significant terms were detected... #> ✔ Done! ORA_two_barplot(res1, res2, Selct.P = 'P', obj.types = c("KEGG", "MsigDB"))

what: Calculate enrichment factor from enrichResult — getEF
title: Calculate enrichment factor from enrichResult — getEF
text: Calculate enrichment factor enrichResult (clusterProfiler).

title: Calculate enrichment factor from enrichResult — getEF
code: getEF(enrichResult)

title: Calculate enrichment factor from enrichResult — getEF
text: enrichResult enrichResult clusterProfiler.

title: Calculate enrichment factor from enrichResult — getEF
text: new enrichResult enrichment factor.

title: Calculate enrichment factor from enrichResult — getEF
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   genes <- c("CANX", "HSPA1B", "KLRC2", "PSMC6", "RFXAP", "TAP1")   obj <- clusterProfiler::enrichGO(genes, "org.Hs.eg.db",                                    keyType = "SYMBOL", ont = "BP"   )   obj2 <- getEF(enrichResult = obj)   obj2@result$EnrichFactor } # }

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

what: Read in gene set information from .gmt files — read_gmt
title: Read in gene set information from .gmt files — read_gmt
text: function reads parses information MSigDB's .gmt files. Pathway information returned list gene sets.

title: Read in gene set information from .gmt files — read_gmt
code: read_gmt(file)

title: Read in gene set information from .gmt files — read_gmt
text: file .gmt file read

title: Read in gene set information from .gmt files — read_gmt
text: list, index represents separate gene set.

title: Read in gene set information from .gmt files — read_gmt
text: .gmt format tab-delimited list gene sets, line separate gene set. first column must specify name gene set, second column used short description (function discards). complete details .gmt format, refer Broad Institute's Data Format's page (url: http://www.broadinstitute.org/cancer/software/gsea/wiki/index.php/Data_formats).

title: Over-representative analysis — simple_GSEA
text: Perform -representative analysis included GO, KEGG, WikiPathways, Reactome, MsigDB, Disease Ontoloty, Cancer Gene Network, DisGeNET, CellMarker, CMAP.

title: Over-representative analysis — simple_GSEA
code: simple_GSEA(   genes,   gene.type = "SYMBOL",   enrich.type = c("GO", "KEGG", "MKEGG", "WikiPathways", "Reactome", "MsigDB", "DO",     "CGN", "DisGeNET", "CellMarker", "CMAP"),   organism = c("Human", "Mouse"),   GO.ont = c("BP", "CC", "MF", "ALL"),   GO.simplify = T,   KEGG.use.internal.data = F,   MsigDB.category = "H",   CMAP.min.Geneset.Size = 3,   pvalue.cutoff = 0.05,   padjust.method = "BH",   min.Geneset.Size = 10,   max.Geneset.Size = 1000 )

title: Over-representative analysis — simple_GSEA
text: genes order ranked geneList. gene.type gene id type input gene. enrich.type Select enrichment method. One GO, KEGG, MKEGG, WikiPathways, Reactome, MsigDB, , CGN, DisGeNET, CellMarker, CMAP. organism Specify species, currently support Human Mouse. GO.ont GO parameter. One "BP", "MF", "CC" subontologies, "" three. GO.simplify GO parameter. Whether remove redundancy enriched GO terms. TRUE, return list raw result result remove redundancy. KEGG.use.internal.data KEGG parameter. Logical, use KEGG.db latest online KEGG data. MsigDB.category MsigDB parameter. MSigDB collection abbreviation, , H, C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, C7. CMAP.min.Geneset.Size CMAP parameter. Minimal size CMAP genes annotated testing. Recommended use 3. pvalue.cutoff pvalue cutoff enrichment tests report significant. padjust.method one "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none". min.Geneset.Size Minimal size genes annotated testing. suitable CMAP. max.Geneset.Size Maximal size genes annotated testing.

title: Over-representative analysis — simple_GSEA
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(geneList, package="DOSE")  # Set enrich.type using an enrichment analysis method mentioned above. fit <- simple_GSEA(geneList, enrich.type = "GO", gene.type = "ENTREZID") } # }

title: KEGG pathway graph visualization — simple_KEGG_graph
text: Simple visualization KEGG pathway based pathview package.

title: KEGG pathway graph visualization — simple_KEGG_graph
code: simple_KEGG_graph(   gene.data,   gene.type = "SYMBOL",   pathway.id,   species = "hsa",   figure.suffix,   save.dir = getwd() )

title: KEGG pathway graph visualization — simple_KEGG_graph
text: gene.data pathview::pathview(). gene.type pathview::pathview(). pathway.id pathview::pathview(). species pathview::pathview(). figure.suffix pathview::pathview(). save.dir dir path save picture.

title: Over-representative analysis — simple_ORA
text: Perform -representative analysis included GO, KEGG, WikiPathways, Reactome, MsigDB, Disease Ontoloty, Cancer Gene Network, DisGeNET, CellMarker, CMAP.

title: Over-representative analysis — simple_ORA
code: simple_ORA(   genes,   background.genes = NULL,   gene.type = "SYMBOL",   enrich.type = c("GO", "KEGG", "MKEGG", "WikiPathways", "Reactome", "MsigDB", "DO",     "CGN", "DisGeNET", "CellMarker", "CMAP"),   organism = c("Human", "Mouse"),   GO.ont = c("BP", "CC", "MF", "ALL"),   GO.simplify = T,   KEGG.use.internal.data = F,   MsigDB.category = "H",   CMAP.min.Geneset.Size = 3,   pvalue.cutoff = 0.05,   qvalue.cutoff = 0.05,   padjust.method = "BH",   min.Geneset.Size = 10,   max.Geneset.Size = 1000 )

title: Over-representative analysis — simple_ORA
text: genes vector gene id. background.genes Background genes. missing, genes listed database (eg TERM2GENE table) used background. gene.type gene id type input gene. enrich.type Select enrichment method. One GO, KEGG, MKEGG, WikiPathways, Reactome, MsigDB, , CGN, DisGeNET, CellMarker, CMAP. organism Specify species, currently support Human Mouse. GO.ont GO parameter. One "BP", "MF", "CC" subontologies, "" three. GO.simplify GO parameter. Whether remove redundancy enriched GO terms. TRUE, return list raw result result remove redundancy. KEGG.use.internal.data KEGG parameter. Logical, use KEGG.db latest online KEGG data. MsigDB.category MsigDB parameter. MSigDB collection abbreviation, , H, C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, C7. CMAP.min.Geneset.Size CMAP parameter. Minimal size CMAP genes annotated testing. Recommended use 3. pvalue.cutoff pvalue cutoff enrichment tests report significant. qvalue.cutoff qvalue cutoff enrichment tests report significant. padjust.method one "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none". min.Geneset.Size Minimal size genes annotated testing. suitable CMAP. max.Geneset.Size Maximal size genes annotated testing.

title: Over-representative analysis — simple_ORA
code: genes <- c("CANX", "HSPA1B", "KLRC2", "PSMC6", "RFXAP", "TAP1") res <- simple_ORA(genes, enrich.type = "GO") #> ℹ Updating gene symbols... #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ℹ Transforming "SYMBOL" to ENTREZID... #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> ℹ Performing GO-"BP" enrichment... #> ℹ 6 significant terms were detected... #> ℹ Symplifying GO results... #> ℹ Return a list with raw enrich result and symplify result ... #> ✔ Done!

what: Generate single-sample gene-set enrichment score — simple_ssgsea
title: Generate single-sample gene-set enrichment score — simple_ssgsea
text: Estimate gene-set enrichment score across samples.

title: Generate single-sample gene-set enrichment score — simple_ssgsea
code: simple_ssgsea(   exp,   gene.list,   method = c("ssgsea", "gsva", "zscore", "plage"),   verbose = TRUE,   BPPARAM = SerialParam(progressbar = verbose) )

title: Generate single-sample gene-set enrichment score — simple_ssgsea
text: exp Numeric matrix containing expression data gene expression signatures, samples columns genes rows. gene.list Gene sets provided either list object GeneSetCollection object. method Method employ estimation gene-set enrichment scores per sample. default set gsva (Hänzelmann et al, 2013) options ssgsea (Barbie et al, 2009), zscore (Lee et al, 2008) plage (Tomfohr et al, 2005). latter two standardize first expression profiles z-scores samples , case zscore, combines together sum divided square-root size gene set, case plage used calculate singular value decomposition (SVD) genes gene set use coefficients first right-singular vector pathway activity profile. verbose Gives information calculation step. Default: TRUE. BPPARAM object class BiocParallelParam specifying parameters related parallel execution tasks calculations within function.

what: Update gene symbol by HGNC — update_symbol
title: Update gene symbol by HGNC — update_symbol
text: Update gene symbol HGNChelper

title: Update gene symbol by HGNC — update_symbol
code: update_symbol(genes, species = c("Human", "Mouse"), unmapGene_keep = F)

title: Update gene symbol by HGNC — update_symbol
text: genes vector gene symbol. species character vector length 1, either "Human" (default) "Mouse" unmapGene_keep whether remove unmapped gene symbol.

title: Update gene symbol by HGNC — update_symbol
code: human <- c("FN1", "TP53", "UNKNOWNGENE","7-Sep", "9/7", "1-Mar", "Oct4",            "4-Oct", "OCT4-PG4", "C19ORF71", "C19orf71") update_symbol(genes = human, unmapGene_keep = TRUE) #> Maps last updated on: Fri May 17 15:09:37 2024 #> ! There have genes mapped to more than one suggested symbol, we only keep the first one ... #>          ID   Symbol #> 1       FN1      FN1 #> 2      TP53     TP53 #> 4     7-Sep  SEPTIN7 #> 5       9/7  SEPTIN7 #> 7      Oct4   POU5F1 #> 8     4-Oct   POU5F1 #> 9  OCT4-PG4 POU5F1P4 #> 10 C19ORF71  TEKTIP1 #> 11 C19orf71  TEKTIP1 #> 12    1-Mar  MARCHF1
